extracted_information: Extracted information for 40 NYC rooftop bars as requested. Note: Main image URLs were not present in the provided web content for any listing.

rooftop_bars.name: Bar 54
rooftop_bars.description: The tallest rooftop bar in Times Square, and also among the highest in NYC, set on the 54th floor of Hyatt Centric Times Square.
features: View of Chrysler Building and lower Manhattan
Seasonal and creative craft cocktails with local influences
Fine selection of beer, wine and small plates

rooftop_bars.name: Bar Cima
rooftop_bars.description: Stylish Latin cocktail bar and lounge on the rooftop of Grayson Hotel. Perched 29 floors above Midtown Manhattan, the indoor-outdoor Bar Cima invites you to an intimate oasis, filled with luxurious touches.
features: Panoramic views over New York City (Empire State Building, East and Hudson Rivers)
Classic cocktails and Latin-inspired creative innovations
Good for drinks and views high above NYC before, during, and after sunset
One of the best for Mezcal and Tequila
Outdoor patio is first come, first served

rooftop_bars.name: Creatures Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Perched on top of Hotel Almeda High Line, in the heart of the lively Chelsea neighborhood, Creatures Rooftop invites to coastal vibes and flavors high above the concrete jungle.
features: Beautiful view of Chelsea and surrounding skyscrapers
Mediterranean and Middle Eastern dishes by Chef Neil Strauber
Refreshing signature cocktails, spritzes, bubbles and beers
Good for happy hour sips and bites

rooftop_bars.name: Castell Rooftop Lounge
rooftop_bars.description: Found on the 21st floor of AC Hotel Times Square, Castell Rooftop Lounge is an all-season refuge to enjoy elevated hours above the bustling streets of the Garment District.
features: Majestic views over the towering Manhattan skyline
Recapturing the spirit of a classic cocktail lounge
Extra love for the iconic Martini
Tasty selection of tapas and shareable plates
Great for gathering with friends, family and coworkers

rooftop_bars.name: Dear Irving on Hudson
rooftop_bars.description: Dear Irving on Hudson is a very stylish, multi-level rooftop & cocktail bar, located on the 40th and 41st floor of Aliz Hotel Times Square.
features: Sweeping 360° views of the Manhattan skyline
Generous and well planned cocktail menu

rooftop_bars.name: Artie’s Backroom & Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Floating high above Midtown East, Artie’s Backroom & Rooftop blends new school energy with old school charm, and features both a cozy interior lounge and a unique outdoor terrace.
features: Stunning view of the Manhattan skyscrapers among brick arches, ivy walls and hanging lanterns
Craft cocktails, wide range of margaritas, martinis and spritz, cold beers and house wine
Good for after works & hangouts with a view
Home to the largest sports viewing screen in Midtown East

rooftop_bars.name: elNico Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Modern rooftop bar and restaurant, filled with Mexican flavors and good times, located in the heart of Williamsburg in Brooklyn.
features: Panoramic views over both the Brooklyn & Manhattan skyline
Mexican food including both light bites and larger plates
Cocktails with a focus on agave-based spirits
Good for Mexican drinks and food
Good for a good time and great views in a lively atmosphere

rooftop_bars.name: Dear Irving on Broadway
rooftop_bars.description: Luxe and speakeasy-inspired cocktail parlor, overlooking the Theater District, located at 1717C Broadway, between 54th & 55th St.
features: Close by skyscraper views in the heart of the Theater District
Cocktail menu pays tribute to Broadway legends
Eclectic selection of light bites (plays on classic NYC street eats, deli staples and theater snacks)
Perfect destination for elevated pre- or post show drinks
Well worth a visit any given night for sophisticated sips and vibes

rooftop_bars.name: Leonessa
rooftop_bars.address: 102 North End Ave, New York, NY 10282
rooftop_bars.description: Perched high above the heart of downtown Manhattan, the open-air Leonessa Rooftop evokes the splendor of an Italian terrace at golden hour, and comes adorned with lush lemon trees, verdant greenery, an Amalfi Coast-inspired fountain and bold, colorful seating.
features: Breathtaking and exceptional views over the Hudson River and the Statue of Liberty
Love letter to Italy's rich drinking traditions
Expertly-curated selection of spirits, wines, beers, and non-alcoholic beverages
Cocktail menu blending timeless classics with inventive modern interpretations
Escape the hustle and bustle of downtown Manhattan
Transport yourself to golden hour on the Amalfi Coast
Cocktails served with a rotating menu of complimentary aperitivo-style snacks
Versatile venue for private events and celebrations

rooftop_bars.name: Haven Rooftop NYC
rooftop_bars.description: Seasonally themed rooftop retreat in the heart of the bustling Theatre District. The Haven Rooftop NYC is situated on top of the lux boutique Sanctuary Hotel New York, right in the city center.
features: Majestic view amidst the skyscrapers in the heart of Times Square and Midtown Manhattan
Modern American cuisine for lunch and dinner
Handcrafted cocktails, wines and a good set of beers
One of the most popular rooftop brunches in NYC

rooftop_bars.name: Elsie Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: 25th floor rooftop lounge, serving seasonal light bites and well-crafted cocktails. The rooftop really brings a slice of fashionable 1920s cocktail bar to the heart of Midtown Manhattan.
features: Surrounded by a wraparound terrace overlooking the Midtown skyscrapers
Progressive mixology cocktails ('Elsie De Wolfe' is a given)
Upscale seasonally focused light fare menu
Fantastic year-round destination for fine after-work drinks with a view
Large communal bar area open for all

rooftop_bars.name: Upstairs at the Kimberly
rooftop_bars.description: Upstairs at the Kimberly is a sophisticated oasis above the buzzing streets below, floating thirty stories above Manhattan, on top of the Kimberly Hotel, in the east part of Midtown.
features: Fantastic views of the iconic Chrysler Building and the impressive cityscape
Large set of crafted specialty cocktails
Fantastic rooftop brunch every weekend between 11-4pm

rooftop_bars.name: The DL
rooftop_bars.description: Located on the corner of Delancey Street & Ludlow in Manhattan’s Lower East Side, The DL NYC is a cool, vibrant and multi-level lounge, offering rooftop, restaurant and event space all in one.
features: Fantastic and unique views over the Lower East Side skyline and the Williamsburg Bridge
Bottle service and sharables like sliders, flat breads and quesadillas
Vibrant daytime events or after work
Hottest and most buzzing outings above Lower East Side
Bottle Service with premium spirits, champagnes, and mixers

rooftop_bars.name: Vida Verde
rooftop_bars.description: Vibrant Mexican dining experience, with Rooftop Margarita Market. Vida Verde is a colorful, creative and tri-level destination from Pmac's Hospitality Group.
features: Located amidst the skyscrapers (not for grand views)
Well-loved Mexican fare mixed with New York’s casual and metropolitan approach
Some of the best Margaritas in town
Rooftop is first come, first served
Inside area open for lunch, dinner and bottomless weekend brunch all year round

rooftop_bars.name: Terrace on 7 | El Ta'koy
rooftop_bars.description: An exclusive and elevated Hawaiian-inspired poolside experience, with both bright and modern year-round interior lounge and outdoor terrace for exciting summer specials.
features: Breathtaking view of the Soho skyline
Modern Asian-Hawaiian gastronomic experience from Chef Luis Pous
Set to transport guests to the shores of Hawaii
Poolside drinks and food with a view of Soho
Book one of the cabanas for exclusive offerings and unique poolside spa services

rooftop_bars.name: BLU33 Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Modern, stylish and seasonal rooftop lounge with premier location and amazing views.
features: Unobstructed views over NYC (Midtown to lower Manhattan, Madison Square Garden, Hudson Yards and Penn Station)
Classic cocktails, local beers, wine and bubbles
Light fare including skewers, pizza and tenders
Great spot for happy hour and sunsets
Great spot for nightly fun with a glowing Manhattan at your feet
First floor BLU33 Restaurant Lounge & Patio Bar open during colder months

rooftop_bars.name: STK Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: STK Rooftop is an upscale and intimate dining room and lounge above the Meatpacking District. The stylish, lush and intimate 4th floor rooftop blends bar, lounge and table seating in a superb way.
features: Prime views over the Meatpacking District, Hudson River and the High Line
Fine selection of wines and bubbles
Great array of signature dishes (raw bar selections, high quality steaks)
Good for social happy hours, memorable dinners under the stars, vibrant DJ nights

rooftop_bars.name: Vue 180 Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Found just steps away from Madison Square Garden, in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, Vue 180 Rooftop is a modern addition to the NYC rooftop heaven.
features: Stunning views of the NYC skyline and most iconic landmarks (Empire State Building as focal point)
Curated selection of both food and drinks
Local and rotating line-up of beer and wine
Good for relaxed cocktails with panoramic views
Cosy winter sessions in the rooftop igloos
Visit during 'Reversed Happy Hour' on weekdays from 7pm
Open daily to everyone on a first come, first served basis

rooftop_bars.name: The Dickens
rooftop_bars.description: Located on 8th Avenue, between 47th and 48th Street, The Dickens is an inclusive, immersive and impressive venue, and a one-of-its-kind destination in the iconic Hell’s Kitchen.
features: Expect vibrant flavors and colors into each cocktail
Happiness, acceptance and vibrant celebrations come together
The only gay-rooftop bar in NYC

rooftop_bars.name: Interlude Rooftop Lounge
rooftop_bars.description: In the heart of Times Square, near Broadway and the Theatre District, Interlude Rooftop Lounge is an upscale and modern addition to the NYC rooftop scene.
features: Indulge in exquisite and hand-crafted cocktails
Ranging from shaken and stirred, to luxurious classics
Memorable, high-quality experience that is as inclusive as it is unique
Perfect spot for some late night cocktails Fri-Sat (open until 2am)

rooftop_bars.name: Harriet's Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Harriet's Rooftop is an urban chic, lush and modern rooftop, with an open-air and seasonal outdoor terrace, as well as an indoor lounge one floor below.
features: Some of the best views over Manhattan
Expect vibrant flavors and colors into each cocktail
Good for sunset cocktails or weekend rooftop party nights
Time your visit when they have live DJs
Small but fantastic rooftop pool (for hotel guests)

rooftop_bars.name: Le Bain & The Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Le Bain & The Rooftop is located at The Standard High Line in downtown New York. More precise in the Meatpacking District.
features: Sweeping views of Hudson River, Downtown Manhattan and the New Jersey skyline
Most focus is on the vibe
Perfect to visit during weekend afternoon for relaxing drinks in the sun
Vibrant feel with live DJs and mingle with a festive crowd at night

rooftop_bars.name: Panorama Room
rooftop_bars.address: 22 N Loop Rd, New York, NY 10044
rooftop_bars.description: Stylish rooftop bar and lounge perched on top of the fabulous Graduate Roosevelt Island, Panorama Room offers quite a unique NYC rooftop experience.
features: Breathtaking 360° views of the Manhattan skyline and surroundings
Only rooftop in NYC with this view
Wide selection of creative and crafted signature cocktails
One of the best views in the world

rooftop_bars.name: Westlight NYC
rooftop_bars.description: Westlight is a year-round rooftop lounge, located on the 22nd floor of the William Vale in the trendy Williamsburg area in Brooklyn.
features: Sweeping city views over the famous Manhattan skyline, East River and surrounding buildings in Brooklyn
Dynamic menu with both classic and original cocktails
Long list of wines, craft beer, rare spirits
Small plates with inspiration of global street food
Good for dynamic menu and sweeping views

rooftop_bars.name: Sandbar Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Hamptons-inspired rooftop oasis, open year-round, found on the 23rd floor of the Hilton New York Fashion District in Chelsea.
features: Nearly 360° views of Manhattan and the Empire State Building
Signature handcrafted cocktails designed by the house mixologist
Relaxing and good-vibes beach escape high above NYC
Open for drinks, bites and views every afternoon and evening
Cosy setting during the colder months

rooftop_bars.name: The Crown
rooftop_bars.description: The Crown rooftop bar is set on top of the fantastic Hotel 50 Bowery, and features both indoor lounge and two outdoor rooftop terraces.
features: Fantastic 360° views over the Big Apple (Brooklyn Bridge, Empire State Building and One World Trade included)
Variety of international bar bites and delicious desserts
One of the most spectacular views in NYC
Come early afternoon for a more relaxed lounge-vibe
Later for nice beats and drinks

rooftop_bars.name: St. Cloud Rooftop Bar
rooftop_bars.description: St. Cloud Rooftop is a mix of cirque-like, biergarten and speak-easy fun, located at the five star Knickerbocker Hotel, just off Times Square.
features: Lovely view of all the Times Square skyscrapers (right among them)
Wide selection of cocktails, craft beers, and champagne on bottle
Menu of tasty bar bites that changes over the season
Break and some stylish afternoon cocktails from the buzzing streets of Times Square
One of the best spots for NYE to watch the 'Ball Drop'

rooftop_bars.name: Overstory
rooftop_bars.description: Elegant, elevated and awarded rooftop cocktail bar, located in Manhattan’s Financial District, or rather high, high above Manhattan’s Financial District.
features: Amazing 360° views over the NYC skyline and all surrounding areas
Plenty of artistic cocktails, crafted to perfection by the mixologists
Fine selection of wine and beer
Some of the best and most well-made rooftop cocktails in the world
Combine drinks with a meal at fine dining restaurant Saga one floor below

rooftop_bars.name: The Roof at PUBLIC Hotel
rooftop_bars.description: Glassed-in rooftop bar with lush outdoor terrace, perched on top of the affordable luxury PUBLIC Hotel on Lower East Side.
features: Panoramic 360° views over the city (amazing anywhere you go up here)
Extensive and varied menu full of delicious and creative cocktails
Vibrant party night with live DJs
Sweeping NYC views as far as the eye can see
Favorite time to visit is during 'Sunset Happy Hour' (Mon-Fri 5pm-7pm)

rooftop_bars.name: JIMMY SoHo
rooftop_bars.description: Classic venue redesigned during 2020, and now a sleek and luxurious rooftop bar sitting on top of the hotel ModernHaus, right in the heart of SoHo.
features: Breathtaking views of the Freedom Tower, New Jersey, and the Empire State Building
Fine selection of crafted and seasonal specialty cocktails
Wines by both the glass and bottle
Fine bar bites created by Michelin-starred chef George Mendes
Daytime rooftop pool party or full night celebration under the stars
Try to make reservations or be in good time

rooftop_bars.name: Electric Lemon
rooftop_bars.description: Perched on top of the five star Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards, Electric Lemon is a luxurious rooftop oasis like no other in NYC.
features: Impressive views over Hudson River and the city skyline
Wide range of food and drinks
Light bites to seasonal offerings at dinner and rooftop brunch on weekends
Large selection of wine, champagne and signature cocktails
Upscale rooftop dinner or an elevated weekend brunch
Amazing rooftop pool overlooking the city skyline and Hudson River (for hotel guests)

rooftop_bars.name: 230 Fifth Rooftop Bar
rooftop_bars.description: 230 Fifth rooftop bar is one of the largest and most famous rooftop bars in NYC, named after its location at 230 5th Ave.
features: Magical views of the Manhattan skyline (Empire State Building as focal point)
Classic & specialty cocktails along with beer and wine
Food ranges from bar bites to more full dinner meals (burgers, salmon, fish & chips, sushi)

rooftop_bars.name: Daintree Rooftop & Lounge
rooftop_bars.address: 25 W 38th St 29th Floor, New York, NY 10018
rooftop_bars.description: Stylish rooftop cocktail bar reimagining the NYC rooftop bar scene from an Aussie point-of-view, perched on top of Hotel Hendricks in the heart of Midtown South.
features: South-facing views includes an unobstructed outlook over the Empire State Building
Cocktails and drinks, including a fine selection of Martinis
Crafted and contemporary versions of New York classics
Wine list with a distinctly Australian accent
Tasty cocktails and bar bites with a view of the Empire State Building
Monthly specials on food and drinks (especially 4-6pm)

rooftop_bars.name: Refinery Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: An all-season rooftop venue, open 7 days a week, located at the five star Refinery Hotel in Midtown Manhattan.
features: Amazing views over the Empire State Building and Manhattan skyline
Wine/champagne/beer in both bottle or by the glass
Nightly drinks and bites in a vibrant atmosphere

rooftop_bars.name: Magic Hour Rooftop Bar & Lounge
rooftop_bars.description: Large indoor/outdoor rooftop bar and lounge, featuring an 'urban amusement park' concept perched on the 18th floor of the fantastic MOXY NYC Times Square.
features: Sweeping skyline views with the Empire State Building as a focal point
Signature cocktails and a full menu of 'curiosities'
Spirits served in all forms and shapes, made perfect to share
Vibrant rooftop brunch with pancakes, eggs, sandwiches, cold pressed juices mixed with Magic Mimosas and cocktails
Priority rooftop access for MOXY guests

rooftop_bars.name: Ophelia
rooftop_bars.address: 3 Mitchell Pl 26th floor, New York, NY 10017
rooftop_bars.description: Feeling a lot like a classic cocktail lounge from the the 1920s and 30s, Ophelia is an intimate rooftop located on top of the historic Beekman Tower.
features: Sweeping 360° views of Manhattan and Brooklyn
Crafted reinventions of classic and unique signature cocktails inspired by natural elements
Small but well-curated selection of 5-star bar bites and dishes
Live DJs highlight the lounge atmosphere
'Social Hours' on weekdays between 5-7pm (good prices on drinks and food)

rooftop_bars.name: Highwater Rooftop
rooftop_bars.description: Floating above the Financial District, Highwater Rooftop is a versitale and bi-level rooftop lounge and event space, mixing interior lounge with four outdoor terraces.
features: Masterfully curated cocktail menu with twists on classic Old Fashions
Lite bites (Shrimp Cocktail, Wagyu Beef Sliders)
Trendy nights with drinks and views
Delicious burger and 'Madison Mule' cocktail recommended

rooftop_bars.name: Bar Blondeau at Wythe Hotel
rooftop_bars.description: Perched on the sixth floor of the fabulous Wythe Hotel in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Bar Blondeau invites to a chic and French-inspired rooftop experience.
features: Sweeping views of the Manhattan skyline and the East River
Seafood-forward food menu (French, Spanish and Portuguese influences)
Crafted signature cocktails and frozen drinks
International selection of natural wines from up-and-coming wine regions
Sunset cocktails followed by a night time party
Stylish indoor lounge with panoramic windows for rainy/colder days
Sundays means afternoon tea service with a view

rooftop_bars.name: Azul Rooftop Bar
rooftop_bars.description: Set on top of Hotel Hugo, between SoHo and the Hudson, Azul Rooftop offers a large slice of Cuban summer vibes in the heart of NYC.
features: 360° views of Lower Manhattan (Freedom Tower and Statue of Liberty included)
Cuban inspired menu both for drinks and food
Weekends: larger crowd and live DJs
Bar Hugo Rooftop (one floor below) is open and available year round

rooftop_bars.name: The Skylark
rooftop_bars.description: The Skylark NYC rooftop is a classic cocktail lounge in New York, located 30th floors above the buzz, near Times Square.
features: Stunning view of the Hudson River, the Empire State Building and Times Square
Large set of mixologist signature cocktails, made with the best ingredients
Tasty bar bites of the highest quality
Only open to the public during weekdays
Visit early for a more private experience
Terrace gets more crowded and live DJs usually bring the atmosphere up a notch later in the night
